info.name: Hikvision DS-7104NI-Q1 / 4P NVR collection
info.description: Collection developed with the purpose of interact with a specific Hikvision Network Video Recorder (NVR) device ## Device specifications - Brand: Hikvision - Model: DS-7104NI-Q1 / 4P - Serial No: DS-7104NI-Q1 / 4P0420200105CCRRE08875843WCVU - Firmware Version: V3.4.99 build 180706 - Encoding Version: V5.0 build 180605 - Web Version: V4.0.1 build 180504 - Plugin Version: V3.0.6.32 - Product official website: [DS-7104NI-Q1 / 4P](https://www.hikvision.com/es-la/products/IP-Products/Network-Video-Recorders/Value-Series/ds-7104ni-q1-4p/) ## Environments and environment variables Two environments called LAN and WAN were developed for using this collection of requests. Inside both of them, you must set 5 environment variables as follows: - NVR_USERNAME: Type: secret - NVR_PASSWORD: Type: secret - NVR_HOSTNAME: Type: default - NVR_PORT: Type: default - NVR_PROTOCOL: Type: default Normally, you would just import both environmets in the \*Environments\* tab on the left and you would have each variable imported with its corresponding type (secret or default) and you would just have to complete each with your own sensitive data ## Authentication Authentication needed for each request is inherited from parent (Check _Authorization_ tab here and then set Auth type, Username and Password fields) - For Auth type: set Digest Auth - For username: set {{ NVR_USERNAME }} - For password: set {{ NVR_PASSWORD }} ## Sources 1. [Device Network SDK_Win64 (V6.1.9.48 |338.44MB |2023/06/14)](https://www.hikvision.com/en/support/tools/hitools/clc33f9cd4117c753a/) 2. [GitHub: loozhengyuan/hikvision-sdk/resources](https://github.com/loozhengyuan/hikvision-sdk/tree/master/resources) 3. [Intelligent Security API (Metadata) - Developer Guide.pdf](https://enpinfo.hikvision.com/unzip/20201110210551_77443_doc/pdf.pdf) #### Details for source No. 1 Once the zip file has been downloaded, unzip it and open the PDF file that can be found at: EN-HCNetSDKV6.1.9.48_build20230410_win64/doc/_**Device Network SDK (General)_Developer Guide_V6.1.7.X_20230606.pdf.**_ File was renamed as _**1 - Device Network SDK (General)_Developer Guide_V6.1.7.X_20230606.pdf**_ #### Details for source No. 2 Download _**isapi.pdf**_ file from the GitHub repository File was renamed as _**2 - Intelligent Security API (General Application) - Developer Guide.pdf**_ #### Details for source reference No. 3 File is downloaded as _**pdf.pdf**_ File was renamed as _**3 - Intelligent Security API (Metadata) - Developer Guide.pdf**_

item.name: ISAPI

body.raw:
<downloadRequest version="1.0" xmlns="http://www.isapi.org/ver20/XMLSchema">
    <playbackURI>
        rtsp://192.168.1.11:80/Streaming/tracks/101/?starttime=20240816T000000Z&endtime=20240816T002426Z&name=00000000197000000&size=1065562088

size, e.g., <playbackURI>rtsp://IpAddress/Streaming/tracks/101?starttime=2016-07-18
00:00:00&endtime=2016-07-18 00:25:04Z&name=00000000721000000&size=1065437356</playbackURI>-->
    </playbackURI>
    <downloadCourseFile>
        <!--optional, xs:boolean, whether to download the course files-->
    </downloadCourseFile>
</downloadRequest>

item.description: ### ISAPI The OPEN Intelligent Security Application Programming Interface (ISAPI) is a text protocol in RESTful style based on HTTP for communicating between security devices/servers (e.g., cameras, DVR, NVR, etc.) and client software/system. It defines the communication standard between device/server and client software/system via the Internet Protocol (IP) and communication protocol layer framework in the figures below. ### REST REST (REpresentational State Transfer) is a protocol design method which abstracts all information as the resources. The abstracted resources are marked by the uniform identifies, i.e., URI (Uniform Resource Identifiers) for simple and extendable management.
